issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Normal iOS behaviour is for a 'slide' animation to occur when a new window is opened via a NavigationGroup and when the iOS native 'back' button is clicked to close the window. It seems that something is broken when running in iOS5 and/or built under recent versions of Titanium builder.

This is also apparent in Kitchensink's Nav Group demos when run under iOS5 on my iPod. The animation works for window open and doesn't when closing it. The window simply closes in the blink of an eye.
fields.summary: Slide animation fails when 'back' button is clicked when project uses NavigationGroup
fields.environment:
Titanium SDK version: 1.7.3 (can't see any ref to a build date though)
iOS5
iPod (2010 model)
OSX 10.6.8
Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.4.201108101535

comments.body:
Thank you for raising this ticket. If this is still an issue, then we need all the information listed in the [Jira Ticket Checklist|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-Summary%3AJiraTicketChecklist] in order to accept the ticket.

Once the ticket is complete, we will look into moving it to the main project.

Thank you.
I'm not including an attachment as you can see this in Kitchensink's Nav Group demos quite easily.
The Kitchen Sink Nav Group demo works correctly on 1.8.0.1. Closing this ticket.

Closing due to inactivity. If this issue still exists, please raise a new ticket, including all the information in the [JIRA Ticket Checklist|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report#HowtoSubmitaBugReport-JIRATicketChecklist] to ensure that we can escalate it quickly. Read [How to Submit a Bug Report|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/How+to+Submit+a+Bug+Report] if you have not read it before, and always start a ticket using the [JIRA Ticket Template|https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/JIRA+Ticket+Template].

Thanks in advance
